results.title: The Journey
results.creator_credit: Christopher Tuckfield, Patricia L'Huede, Aeriel and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the moving portrayal of the extraordinary journey to Japan of 74 year-old Billie Sinclair, who is deaf, blind and mute. Billie has been deaf since the age of two and lost his sight at age ten, but despite this he is a dedicated traveller who funds his trips by weaving and selling baskets. The landscape of his travels is one of touch and smell, imagination and even memory, for he can still remember the time before he lost his sight as a child. This remarkable man has survived and thrived. His is not a handicap but a blessing for it has encouraged him to keep searching and learning. In Japan he rides a roller coaster, tries his hand at Judo and visits a deaf and blind acupuncturist. His world is so sensual, one almost envies it. This documentary achieves a miraculous thing; it transports those possessed of all their senses into a world where communication is by touch alone. And even more miraculously, this world does not terrify.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Tuckfield, Patricia L’Huede, Aeriel and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: The Jolifou inn
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canada of a hundred years ago seen through the paintings of Cornelius Krieghoff, celebrated Dutch artist and adventurer. The changing seasons, the untamed beauty of the Quebec countryside and the French settlers among whom he lived were an unending source of inspiration to Krieghoff, whose work is a colourful record of French-Canadian life in the mid-19th century. Photography by Lyle Enright and Douglas Roberts. Edited by Colin Low. Music by Louis Applebaum. (Awards: Yorkton; Bilbao; Toronto; Kootenay)

results.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience: electric ladyland
results.creator_credit: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Daniel Television, Experience Hendrix and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Jimi Hendrix’s album “Electric Ladyland” is one of the classic rock albums of the 20th century. With songs like “Voodoo Chile”, “Crosstown Traffic”, “Gypsy Eyes”, and “All Along the Watchtower”, it has influenced countless rock guitarists. This documentary, part of the “Classic Album” series, examines both the recording process of the album as well as focusing on the life and legend of Jimi Hendrix. Examining each song on the album, the documentary intersperses interviews with Hendrix’s friends and musicians who played on the album, with footage of Hendrix both playing and being interviewed, photos (including Linda McCartney’s pictures for the album cover), and Hendrix’s notes and journals as well as lots of amazing music. People interviewed include Chas Chandler, Mitch Mitchell, Noel Redding, Buddy Miles, Dave Mason, Mike Finnigan, Steve Winwood and album engineer Eddie Krammer.

results.title: The Jim Stynes story: Dublin's Jim
results.creator_credit: David Barham and Australian Football Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Player Profile Series”.
In the early ‘80’s the Melbourne Football Club recruited an Irish schoolboy and by the start of the next decade, Jim Stynes had taken the art of ruck play to new levels and won the Brownlow medal.

results.title: Hudson
results.creator_credit: Robert Heazlewood, Corporate Communications and Tasmanian Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Player Profile Series”.
Football statistics reveal that there has never been a finer spearhead in the history of Australian Rules Football than Peter Hudson. Historical highlights and interviews provide an insight into the game’s most potent offensive player and prolific goal kicking machine.

results.title: Grateful Dead: anthem to beauty
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre, Daniel Television, Grateful Dead Productions and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Grateful Dead, known for their experimentation and individual approach to music and performance have sustained a career in live performances since the mid 60’s (originating from the San Francisco Bay area). Infamous for their experimentation with music and hallucinogenic drugs, the band are also well known for their loyal fans (known as ‘deadheads’), who have travelled consistently with the band for 30 years. Priceless interviews recounting many humourous and bizarre tales are told in such a ‘matter of fact’ manner, chronicling their journey from experimental “Anthem of the Sun”, to the accessible “American Beauty”. Featuring interviews with core band members; Jerry Garcia, Phil Lesh, Bob Weir, Ron ‘Pigpen’ McKerman, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann, which includes amongst others a rare interview with lyricist Robert Hunte. Other contributors include David Crosby, biographer Dennis McNally, keyboard virtuoso Tom Constanten, producer Steven Barnaco, legendary engineer Dan Healy and Warner Records chief Joe Smith.

results.title: The Islands of Torres Strait
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Torres Strait is a treacherous waterway between Cape York, the northern most tip of the Australian mainland and Papua New Guinea. The shallow strait is dotted with Islands and coral outcrops. From Possession Island at the southern extremity, Captain James Cook formally laid claim to the Australian colonies in the name of England. Later the Queensland Government moved to control the Islands of the Strait and their people. Once, the islanders currency of trade was human heads, and headhunting raids between the islands and mainland Papua New Guinea was part of life. On this journey through the islands, Ted Egan meets some old friends, sees dugout canoes being built and meets the keeper of the legendary Drums of Mer.

results.title: Norfolk Island: From Hell to Paradise
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Norfolk Island is an eight by six kilometre paradise set in the blue waters of the South West Pacific Ocean about 1,500 kilometres east of the Australian mainland. The island was secured by the British in 1788 just a few weeks after settlement at Sydney Cove. It was abandoned after a few years, until 1824 when it became one of the most terrible and feared penal settlements. The graveyards and chronicles testify to the brutality and terror of those awful years. The island was abandoned but eventually re-settled by descendants of the Bounty mutineers who moved there from the more isolated Pitcairn Island in 1856.
